result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Adam Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Adam Bradley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gregory Adam Bradley
Current: P.O. Box 431, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2014)
Prior: 704 Old Hwy 32; PO Box 431, Carter, WI 54566

Called at 11:08 AM. Also called 14CF37 and 14CF31. Gregory Bradley appears in person and with counsel Amy Ferguson. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State - have resolution - on 13CF198 - amend count #1 to city of crandon ordinance prohibiting obstructing with a fine of $1000 plus costs - take bond from 14CF37 to pay this; amend #2 to county ordinance of DC - fine of $500 plus costs - take bond posted, #3 - dismissed; 14CF31 - #1 - plead as alleged, costs and restitution of $110.00 including VW surcharge - take bond posted, #2 - amend to mids BJ - costs only; 14CF37 = #1 - plead as alleged, joint recommendation of costs, I&S 180 days jail, place on probation for 2 years consecutive to sentence on count #2; #2 - amend to mids BJ - NC - 180 days jail, I&S - consecutive to count #1 (?); #3 - amend to county ordinane of possession of drug parahanalia, $1000 fine plsu costs, #4 - amend to mids BJ - NC - I&S 180 days jail, consecutive to #2; conditions of: AODA and follow thru, restitution of $110.00, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or prescrition drugs that are not prescribed to himn, no taverns or bars, employment/school, 200 hours of community service. Bradley agrees. Court - on 14CF37 - amend #3 to county ordinance of possession of drug para, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $1000 plus costs - take from bond posted; pleads NC to count #1 as alleged, #2 - amend to mids BJ contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new penalties - pleads NC, #4 - amend to misd BJ contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - pleads NC; 14CF31 - #1 - amend to misc BJ contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - pleads NC, #1 - pleads as alleged; 13CF198 - amend #1 to city or crandon obstructing ordinance - pleads NC - fine of $1000 plus costs totalling $1464.50, #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500 plus costs totalling $834.50; #3 - dismiss. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State withholds comment. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 8 days only if revoked. Bradley makes statement, remoresful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CF37 - #1 - impose 180 days in FCjail, stayed, probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school with verbage, 200 hours of community service, attend at least on AA/NA meeting each week, obtain GED within first 6 months of probation, 30 days of conditional jail - stayed - if employed within first 90 days - does not have to serve this jail time and serve 30 days each time that the defendant is not employed during probation (school can satisfy this condition, costs - paid within 90 days; #2 - 180 days in FC jail - consecutive #1 - stayed, probation for 2 years with same conditions except no additional community service; #4 - 180 days in FC jail - conseuctive to #2 - stayed, probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #2, with same conditkons, costs - paid with 90 days, DNA surcharge of $200 for one count - paid within 90 days, transfer any money to 14CF31, 14CF41 - restit of $110.00 - 90 DTP if not enough money left over from other cases, costs; #2 - costs only - 90 DTP; 13CF198 - fines to be paid in 120 days, right to appeal, adjourned.

Called at 3:11 PM. Also called 14CF31 and 14CF37. Greg Bradley appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Amy Ferguson appears in person. State not in the courtroom at this moment. Ferguson - waiving all PH's today. Bradley agrees. Court has waiver of PH form for all three cases, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH on all cases, finds probable cause on all cases, binds all three cases over for trial, proceed to ARGN. State has filed all Informations that mirror the complaints. Ferguson has Information for all three matters, waives reading of them, pleads NG to all counts, set for FPT. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on all three cases, sets all three matters for FPT on 6/18/14 at 10:00 AM.
Final pre-trial on June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns and no contact with Kari Howard.
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 1:31 PM. Also called 13CF198 and 14CF37. Gregory Bradley appears in person and in custody with attorney Amy Ferguson. State appears by Charles Simono. State - here for INIT on 14CF37 and 14CF31. Court - 13CF198 - here on return of bench warrant off of a non-appearance for a PH. Court will deal with 14CF37 - Ferguson has complaint, waves reading, requests PH for that matter. State - 14CF37 - $2500 cash with no consumption of alcohol. Ferguson responds - asks for signature bond for stated reasons - is on P&P hold. Court - 14CF37 - bond - $2500.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol. Court - 14CF31 - Ferguson has complaint and waives reading, requests PH. State- bond - 14CF31 - $2500.00 cash with same conditions. Ferugson has same argument for signature bond. Court - $2500.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns and no contact with Kari Howard. Discussion on PH, defendant is on hold, Ferguson will waive time limits for PH on both cases. Court sets all matters for PH on 4/30/14 at 3:00 PM. State - 13CF198 - $2500.00 cash. Court continues bond on that matter.
